title: Some of the skins in league have some pretty cool lore behind them
body:
For example, take {{champion:266}} 
His justicar skin is how he appears to the people he aids.
His Sea Hunter skin is how he appears to the people of Bilgewater.
*edit: I done goofed. This is how he would appear as a Marai pirate.
Mecha Aatrox is not actually Aatrox, but a robot created by Rumble and Heimerdinger, inspired by the legends of Aatrox.

For some champions, you have to stretch it a little bit, but you can get some cool things out of it
{{champion:103}} 
Dynasty and Midnight are how she dressed while she was still seducing humans for their souls, just her daytime and nighttime dress.
Foxfire is how she appeared just after becoming human.
Popstar is what her career would have been if she had not become a champion in the "league" (or whatever it is that these champions are fighting for)
Challenger is how she would have appeared if she had continued to consume the souls of humans.
Academy is how she would have appeared if she had gone to school.

On some champions, we can only speculate wildly
{{champion:32}} 
Pharaoh: If we assume this to be cannon like the other skins, then this is Amumu post mummification, about to be placed in a sarcophagus. We can also assume this to mean that he was a Shuriman king while he lived.
Little knight Amumu is the start of a little story arc. Amumu came back from the dead with no memories, and no knowledge of the world. With this in mind, he went to school with Annie (probably with some illusion magic that he got by having some mage take pity on him). While in this school, he got a role in the school play, which featured the legends of king Arthur. On opening night, he broke the sword prop, and was kicked out of the play. After a couple of months, Amumu had the idea of wrapping himself up and sending himself as a gift to Annie, his only friend. He got re-gifted. Later, he almost became prom king, but lost to some guy with Trump Hair. This defeat drove Amumu into a deep depression, which is seen in Emumu.
Sad Robot was an AI that was made to replicate Amumu's state of persistent sadness for research purposes. Also, they were allowed to do more to a Robot than to a real (even if undead) person.
In Suprise Party, some of the other champions threw a Party to celebrate the memory of Urf. Amumu came to join the fun, but he ran into the table with the cake, knocked it over, and ruined it. He got kicked out.

Right now no, we don't have many skin lines that share the same alternate fantasy. However I would really like them to! I think each major skin line should be paired with an adversary so players can write awesome fanfic, play skin vs skin games etc. but there's no reason to stop there. Perhaps iBlitzcrank and PROJECT exist in the same world, but the iBlitzcranks are more like mass-produced private law enforcement while PROJECT are unique members of a cutting edge military experiments? If it's anything like Dominion: Tank Police I could see Officer Caitlyn and Vi rolling alongside an iBlitzcrank unit on Akira-eque motorcycles down the streets of New New Piltover. Compared to them though I would imagine more extreme anime skins like Super Galaxy Rumble and Neon Strike Vi might be what they watch on TV after a long shift.

Pulsefire Ezreal, as our very first sci-fi skin, never had any rivals but we have talked a lot about it as he is clearly fighting for the future of all mankind with his awesome tech. I personally think that Eternum would be a good match as they are inspired by the Mass Effect Reapers - beings from the darkness of space come to harvest mankind.

Battlecast is for the most part less advanced. They are Robotnik'd* slaves with engines that spew black columns of smoke from diesel engines. During the tease for Battlecast Prime Cho'gath there was mention of blueprints acquired by 'The Resistance'. It was most likely imagined as a sort of Terminator future where Skynet is replaced with Viktor and there's no time travel to save them. Could be Full Metal Jayce, could be Resistance Caitlyn, could be both. I really hope in the future we have answers for you!

*In the teaser for Vel'koz it describes how Viktor captured Vel'koz, encased his flesh in metal and inhibited the functions/freedom of his mind. Just like a certain Egg-shaped Doctor on Mobius.
